Instrument Host Overview ======================== McDonald Observatory Harlan J. Smith 2.7m (107in) Telescope
The information included here was extracted from the McDonald Observatory web site at:
http://mcdonaldobservatory.org/
on 24 April 2002 by A.C.Raugh.
Observatory Information ======================= McDonald Observatory is administered by the University of Texas at Austin. Telescopes are located on Mt. Locke in the Davis Mountains of West Texas.
East longitude: -104 01.3 Latitude: +30 40.3 Elevation: 2075 meters above sea level
Telescope Information ===================== Harlan J. Smith optical telescope
Primary Mirror Diameter: 2.72m (107 in) Focal Length: 10.68m ( 35 ft) f-ratio: 3.93
The telescope has three focal points:
Cassegrain f/8.8 Cassegrain Coude Ritchey-Chretien f/17.7 f/32.5
Focal Length 23.91m/78.4ft 47.98m/157.4ft 88.43m/290.1ft f-ratio 8.8 17.65 32.54 Field Angle 61.5 arcmin 31 arcmin 3 arcmin Plate Scale 8.62 arcsec/mm 4.29 arcsec/mm 2.32 arcsec/mm
